description: Medical Latin, from Ancient Greek διὰ σκορδίων (dià skordíōn), from σκόρδιον (skórdion, “scordium”).

entries.meaning: (obsolete, pharmacology) A medicine made from dried herbs, especially Teucrium scordium.
examples: Laudanum Paracelsi is prescribed in two or three grains, with a dram of diascordium, which Oswald. Crollius commends.
